prompts.prompt:
Create a square social media ad for a mortgage marketplace targeting real estate investors.

The scene: A 3D clay diorama showing a network of pathways—350 tiny clay doors arranged in a radiating pattern, all converging toward a single glowing doorway in the center. The center door is larger, made of warm terracotta clay with a soft green glow emanating from within. The surrounding doors are in muted sage and cream tones, creating depth through repetition.

The clay has that satisfying handmade quality—visible finger-pressed textures, soft rounded edges on each miniature door, matte finish with gentle highlights catching light from above. The entire network sits on a deep navy (#011a40) platform.

Frame the composition with a thick 10-pixel border in teal (#46be8a), neo-brutalist style but warm. Generous negative space at top.

Typography: Bold sans-serif headline "350+ LENDERS" in cream white, stacked. Below: "One search. 60 seconds." in the same teal as the border, lighter weight.

The mood is clarity through abundance—not overwhelming, but empowering. The feeling of having every option at your fingertips.

Aspect ratio 1:1, high resolution for Meta feed placement.

Create a square social media ad for mortgage services targeting borrowers who've faced rejection.

The scene: A clay figure (abstract, no face—just a simplified human form in warm terracotta) standing before three closed doors in gray clay, cracked and weathered. But the figure is turning toward a fourth door—this one in vibrant teal (#46be8a), slightly ajar with warm golden light spilling through the gap.

The clay textures are essential: the rejected doors show deliberate imperfections, almost like they've been pressed closed. The open door has smooth, inviting edges. Subtle fingerprint impressions throughout give handmade authenticity.

Background: Soft cream (#F5F0E8) with a confident 8-pixel deep navy (#011a40) border framing the scene.

Typography in the upper negative space: "REJECTED 3 TIMES" in bold charcoal, then below in teal: "Approved in 48 hours."

The emotional note: resilience and relief—not pity. This is about finding the door that opens, not dwelling on the ones that didn't.

Aspect ratio 1:1, high resolution for Meta feed placement.

Create a square social media ad for a fast mortgage platform targeting time-sensitive investors.

The scene: A 3D clay hourglass, but instead of sand, tiny clay houses are flowing from top to bottom. The hourglass is made of teal (#46be8a) clay with thick, satisfying edges. Inside, 6 or 7 miniature cream-colored clay houses tumble through, some already collected at the bottom, others mid-fall.

The hourglass sits slightly off-center on a deep navy (#011a40) surface. The clay has visible handmade texture—the hourglass frame shows finger-pressed impressions, the tiny houses have soft, rounded roofs and walls.

Bold 10-pixel terracotta border frames everything. Soft shadows ground the hourglass in space.

Typography to the left in the negative space: "DEALS DON'T WAIT" in bold cream, stacked vertically. Smaller beneath: "856 borrowers found their rate this month."

The mood is urgency without panic—confident momentum. Time matters, but you're in control.

Aspect ratio 1:1, high resolution for Meta feed placement.

Create a square social media ad for a mortgage comparison platform.

The scene: A 3D clay magnifying glass with a teal (#46be8a) handle, positioned over a surface showing two contrasting worlds. Under the magnifying glass: a rich, detailed landscape of opportunities—tiny clay buildings, pathways, keys, dollar signs, all in warm terracotta and sage tones. Outside the magnifying glass: the same scene but in flat, muted gray—like an undeveloped photograph.

The magnifying glass itself is chunky, tactile clay with visible fingerprint texture on the handle. The lens area shows crisp clarity. Everything sits on a deep navy (#011a40) base.

Thick 8-pixel warm coral border. The composition leaves breathing room at top for text.

Typography: "WHAT 350+ LENDERS KNOW" in bold charcoal at top. Below in teal: "That your bank won't tell you."

The feeling is discovery and insider access—like someone just handed you the key to information you didn't know existed. Curious, not suspicious.

Aspect ratio 1:1, high resolution for Meta feed placement.

Create a square social media ad for mortgage services targeting self-employed professionals.

The scene: A clay puzzle being assembled—but instead of traditional puzzle pieces, each piece represents a different income stream: one shaped like a laptop, one like a storefront, one like a graph trending up, one like a document. Four pieces are already connected in warm terracotta clay, with a fifth piece (in teal #46be8a) being placed by an abstract clay hand entering from the edge.

The puzzle sits on a cream (#F5F0E8) surface. Each piece has that satisfying clay texture—soft edges, visible fingerprint impressions, matte finish with subtle highlights. The connected pieces fit together imperfectly but completely—intentionally showing that complex income still forms a whole picture.

Deep navy (#011a40) 10-pixel border, brutalist but warm.

Typography in generous upper space: "SELF-EMPLOYED?" in bold navy. Below: "Banks don't get your income. We do." in teal.

The mood is validation and understanding—finally being seen as a whole person, not a checklist of missing documents.

Aspect ratio 1:1, high resolution for Meta feed placement.

Create a square social media ad comparing fast vs slow mortgage processes.

The scene: A split composition. Left side: a clay snail carrying a tiny bank building on its shell, moving along a long winding path—the snail is gray, the path is tedious, the bank is institutional and cold. Right side: a clay rocket (in teal #46be8a) already landed at a finish line, with a warm terracotta house beside it, flag planted.

Both elements are made of tactile 3D clay with visible handmade texture—the snail's shell has spiral fingerprint impressions, the rocket has chunky, satisfying proportions. They sit on a cream surface with a subtle dividing line.

A thick 8-pixel deep navy (#011a40) border frames everything. The contrast between the two sides is the story.

Typography centered at top: "3 WEEKS" on left side, "48 HOURS" on right side, both in bold charcoal. Below the scene in teal: "Same property. Different lender."

The feeling is confident speed—not rushed or reckless, but efficient and purposeful. Why would you choose slow?

Aspect ratio 1:1, high resolution for Meta feed placement.
